Package br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder

Class ThreadBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.armange.commons.thread.builder.ThreadBuilder
  • public final class ThreadBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible for simplifying and speeding up the creation and configuration of threads.
    The implementation of threads can be simplified using one of the four classes below.
    • CommonRunnableThreadBuilder: To implement threads that run tasks but do not need to return values after execution. See setExecution(Runnable).
    • TimingRunnableThreadBuilder: To implement threads that run tasks but do not need to return values after execution. However, they can be configured with scheduling options such as delay, interval or timeout, for example. See setScheduling(Runnable)
    • CommonCallableThreadBuilder: To implement threads that execute tasks and return values after execution. See setExecution(Callable)
    • TimingCallableThreadBuilder: To implement threads that execute tasks and return values after execution. However, they can be configured with scheduling options such as delay, interval or timeout, for example. See setScheduling(Callable)
    Since:
    2020-06-22 V1.1.0 (JDK 1.8)

      • setExecution

        public CommonRunnableThreadBuilder setExecution​(java.lang.Runnable execution)
        Sets the thread task that can be configured with some common resources.
        Parameters:
        execution - the Runnable interface should be implemented by any class whose instances are intended to be executed by a thread. The class must define a method of no arguments called run.
        Returns:
        a thread builder with scheduling settings options.

      • setExecution

        public <S> CommonCallableThreadBuilder<S> setExecution​(java.util.concurrent.Callable<S> execution)
        Sets the thread task that can be configured with some common resources.
        Type Parameters:
        S - the type of the object resulting from the execution of the thread.
        Parameters:
        execution - a task that returns a result and may throw an exception.
        Returns:
        a thread builder with common settings options.
